prompt: Facts: The case pertains to a series of murders committed on the intervening night of August 12/13, 1977, in a village in Punjab.; The appellants (Machhi Singh and others) were involved in a long-standing feud with the family of Amar Singh and Mohinder Singh.; A prior incident had led to the conviction and sentencing of close relatives of Machhi Singh.; Seeking revenge, Machhi Singh and his companions launched a pre-planned attack on the households connected to Amar Singh and Mohinder Singh.; During the night, the assailants systematically attacked five different dwelling houses.; A total of seventeen persons (men, women, and children) were killed during these attacks.; The attacks were carried out with firearms and possibly other weapons.; Survivors of the attacks acted as eyewitnesses and identified the assailants.; The Sessions Court convicted the appellants under Sections 302 read with Section 149, and Section 148 of the IPC.; The Sessions Court sentenced Machhi Singh and several other principal accused to death, while others received life imprisonment.; The High Court of Punjab and Haryana confirmed the death sentences for the appellants.; The appellants appealed to the Supreme Court challenging their convictions and, more significantly, the imposition of the death penalty. | IPC: Section 302 (Punishment for Murder), Section 149 (Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object), Section 148 (Rioting, armed with deadly weapon), Section 34 (Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention - discussed in principle though conviction was primarily under S.149)
